intro: Spermacoce nigricans, commonly known as black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows as an annual herb or shrub. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, dark seeds. Botanically, it is characterized by its simple leaves and its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
